intro: Cryptocarya ainikinii, commonly known as the Koa tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in yellow-green hues. It typically grows as a medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 20 meters in its natural habitat. Cryptocarya ainikinii plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
